The Volunteering team have realised there is a text field missing on the Accessible form. It should have â€˜Town of birthâ€™. 
 
At the same time the team have requested that we add another field â€“ Volunteer code. This is not the Identifier field but the code people get to use on the ATOS system. Adding this field will allow people to monitor whether people are indeed from a specialist user group.

Hi Jamie

Do you have an update on this?

Label: Volunteer code
Help test: This is not the dentification code you were supplied

Have you any better / more correct wording for wither of these? Maybe for the code you should mention length and give an example? esp. as you have already asked they to enter a code on the previous page - given this is an *accessible* form it's getting increasingly complex :-)

thanks

> This is not the Identifier field but the code people get to use on the ATOS system

comments.value:
And i'm pretty sure it shouldn't?

Liz Goulding
Senior New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012

Afraid that is how it works, obviously if nothing is linking to it then that shouldn't be an issue.

Is it appearing somewhere it shouldn't be?

btw. publishing a page that has an image assigned to it also causes the image to get published automatically.

I figured publishing the page would do it ... but not necessarily approving the image.

Theyâ€™re appearing in the latest images on the photos hub.

Issue is that i approve an image, then search for an event to relate it to. Occasionally that event hasnâ€™t actually been approved yet, but there is no way for me to tell that until after iâ€™ve approved the image.

Approve and publish (up until now) have been almost interchangeable as for normal user uploaded images it made no difference.

Although it sounds like the 'approved' *event* images are actually getting image pages created for them as well ??!! (as that is what we do for the normal user uploaded images) and then appearing in latest user uploads, which is totally wrong in both cases.

Will see what I can do here, to be honest with you, had I known (and this is a leftover from Marna/I know we have been here before) I would never have let us allow images to be uploaded the way they are, as the backend UGC API's are geared up for accepting user uploaded images and not for images attached to an event. The problem was we had already started using it in this way and I was concerned that ripping it all out and starting again was going to cause more issues (in fact I should have just stopped that feature being used till we had a new backend built).

I know the requirement seems really basic, but we have no off the shelf mechanism for letting users submit a front end form *with* an image attached so that the image and details comes though in the back end tied together (we also have the issue of how to allow you to approve/reject the image in the event editor itself). Had I known (and yes I should have kept a better eye on Marna and the requests she was agreeing to!) this was a serious requirement we would have proposed to construct the Event upload stuff totally differently (although it would have required a much larger amount of custom code, so possibly would have suggested that we ask users to just add a link to any assets/images they wanted us to use as an easy/cost effective workaround).

In short we're half way into the woods on this one and I wish I could get out as I feel I'm digging an even deeper hole ;-)

Anyway, back to question at hand..

- We'll add in some logic to stop pages being created for these images.
- That should stop them appearing in 'latest' images.

As so for assigning, I think you should be able to assign the un-approved images in the Events' editor ie. you wont' need to approve them first and then as soon as the events get published the images wil get approved/published.

Jamie

No no, the images coming through for event pictures are just being â€˜assignedâ€™ to individual event pages. So they appear in the page there, not going onto totally separate pages.

Does that make more sense?

Hi Liz,

Yep they should be..

But (and just realised this) their not.. (assume they shouldn't appear here)
http://www.london2012.com/photos/user-photos/summer-fun-festopen-weekend-image-upload.php

In short we are using the user upload feature to handle the images attached to events which is so totally wrong (and so cross with myself for not putting my foot down earlier here, I should have know it would end it pain!)

Here's my plan:

- All new uploaded images go into a new /uploads/ow folder (tbh. I though we we;re already doing this)
- I then identify and move all the OW images (regardless of status) into this new folder
- We scrap any approve/reject workflow [attaching an image to an event is in effect approving it]
- We then just reply on the fact that if you attach an image to a page and published it, the image gets published to.

* The ideal would be to assign the image to the Event when we create the Event page, the problem here is that if we do that then when the event gets published the images goes with it / we have no way to approve reject the image in the events editor. We could work the other way round and assign the image and then rely on editors to clear any image they didn't want used?

Jamie

Ok this sounds good. So, in order to see whatâ€™s been submitted i can go to the OW folder (in order to find names of pics). Then i wonâ€™t need to approve, i can just go to the event pages, search for the appropriate pic and publish. If i donâ€™t like a pic, i can just delete it.

Yes? Is that right?

Yep, that's right..

Now a deep breath while I start the operation..... tongs, scalpel.. ;-)

:-P

Thanks, Jamie.

comments.value:
Setup staging server and copying across a one time sync of web01

(there is a separate ticket dealing with integrating the two new staging servers into the existing publication work flow and modifying the rsync as ness.)

We now have both staging servers delivering a snapshot of web01 from yesterday.

http://213.120.228.148/
http://213.120.228.149/

(for SSH access we use 10.137.212.203  / 204 respectively; but only seem to have access from web01 atm)

However the staging server is not a complete clone of the live server, specifically:

- We have no domain names to use for name based virtual hosts, the server is simply delivery one site.
- The httpd.conf is not a complete clone (partly due to the above), I have keep a diff of the files in /home/webcontent on stage03
- SSL has not been set up on the staging servers (once again we need a domain to tie the cert to)
- Some of the more specific rules in httpd.conf relating to Expired headers that are on the live site are not on the staging server yet

In short I have kept httpd.conf as simple and un modified as I can in order that a site can be delivered, I think we need a separate conversation re. how we much we want to keep the httpd.conf on the live servers in sync with the staging servers, what is required from our end to achieve this and finally who is responsible for updating, what is effectively a system config file, both now and going forward and what is the best way of managing this, do we create some scripts to auto generate the various versions? why writes and runs those scripts?

--

Previous correspondence:

--

I have synced /apps/apache/ from web01 so 10.137.212.203 (Olympic-stage03.btgs2-bt-locog) should now have a one off copy of whatever was on web01 when I ran the sync.

This is the command I used from web01:

rsync -av --delete /apps/apache/ --exclude=*_log webcontent@10.137.212.203:/apps/apache/

I have not synced from stage03 to stage04 (a modification of the above will work if this needs to be done)

However we are unable to access either stage03 to stage04 via SSH/HTTP/HTTPS from our dev environment or our office router (we can do this on web01 and web02)

This is the list of IP's that need access:

94.193.102.181 (kitsite office router)
89.187.66.118 (milo.kitsite.com)
89.187.66.113 (dev.kitsite.com)
89.187.66.117 (koala.kitsite.com)
89.187.66.120 (roo.kitsite.com)

Additionally  stage03 to stage04 should also allow outgoing connections to the above machines via SSH/HTTP/HTTPS

Until we can access the above machines via port 80 it is hard to test if the site has synced successfully.

---

I notice that we just have a sample Apache config file (/etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf)

We can create one that semi-reflects the live servers but it goes back to this issue of change control and who is responsible for system level config files?

In my experience the core Apache config file tends to be seen as part of the core system stack on a web server, with application level additions being added via additional config files or .htaccess files. This way is something breaks at the the app level, the includes can be commented out and the default configuration tested in isolation ie. a clear division of responsibility/ who's responsibility it is to fix the issue.

Moving into a production environment I would say it is imperative that the 6 live and 2 staging servers all share a common server configuration file (where possible) that is generated 'on the fly' from a single master file, which is held in a version control system like SVN or Git and that this is normally seen as a task for the systems team.

However if in the interests of just getting things moving ;-) if you want us to just set one up for the time being, could you get stage3.london2012.com and stage4.london2012.com setup as sub domains (I think Demy's do this?). That way we can add them as a ServerName which will make accessing them for testing easier.
Jamie, can you just confirm: do you want us to bill 2 days just for this or does this include http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/1029?

Hi Danny,

This is ticket 1029 ;) but the other ticket is for the integration of the server into the ongoing workflow at the moment we're just setting it up as a one time thing.


So far:

- Setup Apache httpd.conf on both servers
- Synced a copy of the site from web01 to stage04
- Setup domain names
- Replaced all the base hrefs
- Uploaded DSA_SLA_test_pages
- Time spent researching, investigating and responding to emails
- Setup Expires and ETags on staging servers
- Synced staging servers

Amongst other tasks, so far I have spent at least two days on this, but it's a bit of a rolling target / ticket..
Marking as solved.

Jamie, re my stupid comment: "do you want us to bill 2 days just for this or does this include http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/1029?"

I meant http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/1030.

subject: Setup staging server and copy across a one time sync
description:
Setup staging server and copying across a one time sync of web01

(there is a separate ticket dealing with integrating the two new staging servers into the existing publication work flow and modifying the rsync as ness.)

Is it possible please to create a tooltip (similar to the ones you have created on the accessible form) in the pink include 'When to apply'. The tooltip should link from the words 'When to applyâ€™, as follows:

Online applications are now open for pre-identified applicants for specialist roles, special interest groups and members of a number of pre-identified disability organisations. All other applicants â€“ generalists and specialists who havenâ€™t been pre-identified â€“ can apply from Wednesday 15 September.

Lars,

I think Morag just wants a little DHTML box that pops up (ala the question mark hover-ovre-hox on the accessible form) 
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/access-games-maker/index.php

Hi Morag,

Do you still want us to do this?
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/index.php

The box actually expands to fill as much text as you put into it (although realise you may think that is too much text to show at once).

On alternative to the tool tip which is more commonly used elsewhere n the site, is to add a 'read more' link and make the box expand using JS.

The quickest / easiest approach would just be to link off to a new page that could contain as much extra text about when to apply as you wanted. Although it looks like you only really have an extra line of text you have to fit in.

The reason we're querying this ticket is that (straw poll of the office!) a 'tool tip' is slightly out of place there both in terms of styling (we don't use them anywhere else on the site apart form on the new forms) and usage.

Happy to add a hover-over 'tool tip' box in, just wanted to check the rational behind it in case we could think of a neater solution for you.

thanks

Jamie

Hello

Just checked re: this.

We do still need you to create a tooltip, Iâ€™m afraid. I know itâ€™s not in line with the rest of the site, but the client wants it so .... â˜¹

Could you use this text rather than the one I sent previously (slight change):

Online applications are now open for pre-identified applicants for specialist roles (such as doctors and nurses), special interest groups and members of a number of pre-identified disability organisations.
All other applicants â€“ generalists and specialists who havenâ€™t been pre-identified â€“ can apply from Wednesday 15 September.

Thank you though for your eminently sensible suggestions!

Morag
